wikipedia_page.main: Peter Moore (29 August 1939 – 20 December 2009) was a British town crier. He worked for the London Tourist Board, the Mayor of London, the cities of London and Westminster, and the boroughs of Southwark, Kingston upon Thames, Tower Hamlets, Merton, Haringey, Redbridge and Ealing.

response: Peter Moore, the London Town Crier, held the position for more than 30 years. He was Town Crier to the Mayor of London, the City of Westminster, and London boroughs, and was also a freeman and liveryman of the City of London. He died on 20 December 2009.

*Peter Moore (Queensland politician) (born 1938), member of the Queensland Legislative Assembly

*Peter Moore (trombonist) (born 1996), winner of BBC Young Musician of the Year in 2008

*Peter Moore (town crier) (1939–2009), town crier of London
*Peter Moore, British computer consultant kidnapped in Iraq; see Foreign hostages in Iraq#United Kingdom
*Peter Moore, executive producer of various television documentaries, including 638 Ways to Kill Castro
*Peter Moore (The Messengers), fictional character in TV series, The Messengers

Thames News produced its final full-length programme on Wednesday, 23 December 1992, presented by Steve Clarke (a former presenter of the BBC's rival London Plus programme) and Gytha Hutton (a reporter based in Thames' Guildford newsroom). The very last bulletin was broadcast on New Year's Eve, Thursday, 31 December 1992 and presented by regular sports anchor Graham Miller. The bulletin closed with the town crier of London, Peter Moore, announcing the end of Thames News after 15 years.
